item.title: Preamble to the will of Robert Webley, 1549
item.description:
Part of the will of Robert Webley, 1549, Herefs RO 44/2/10
Asset Author: 
Sylvia Pinches
Copyright: 
University of London

After the date, the will opens with an expression of faith. It says:

I Robert Webley of Eastnor in the diocese of Hereford sick in my body and, lauded be God, of good and whole mind and perfect remembrance make my testament and last will in form following: First and above all things I commend my soul to Almighty God the father of heaven, trusting through his great mercy and by the merits of the passion and blood shedding of his only son my saviour and redeemer Jesus Christ to have remission and forgiveness of all my sins; my body to be buried where shall it please God to call for me, by the discretion of mine executors...

Asset File: 
44_2_10_Robert_Webley_preamble.jpg
item.dc:creator: SylviaP

item.title: Will and Inventory of Jone Hawtrell, widow, 1589
item.description:
Copyright: 
VCH Hampshire

Hawtrell died six months after her husband, George Hawtrell died. It is interesting to note the changes in the provisions made for the family. The younger daughter had married, but the £10 left by her mother is to be kept for six years by her executor, her son in law, her elder daughter’s husband who is the major beneficiary – no mention of her son.  The daughters share the household goods, and there are gifts to three granddaughters and a heifer to a grandson, and several bequests to the Funge family and to servants and other family members. Interestingly there are bequests of bee stalls to two people (bees not mentioned in her husband’s will, so probably always her own property). The estate value is £11 16s. 0d. and there are debts due of £10 1s. 11d. amounting to more than her husband’s estate.

Asset File: 
joan_hawtrell_widow_wi_hro_1589a-045.pdf
item.dc:creator: JeanM

item.title: Will and Inventory of Ralph Couper 1558
item.description:
Copyright: 
VCH Hampshire

Couper bequeathed four sheep to Dummer church. His inventory lists horses, oxen, sheep, pigs, wool and crops which he left to his wife and six children as well as other kinsmen. The inventory totals £46 17s. 9d. He had connections with parishes of Heckfield and Wield as noted by the men entrusted with carrying out his instructions.

Asset File: 
ralph_couper_wi_hro_1558u-054.pdf
item.dc:creator: JeanM

item.title: Will and Inventory of Christopher Bodycot/Bodicote 1558
item.description:
Copyright: 
VCH Hampshire

Bodicott/Bodycot left a sheep to the church in the nearby parish of Bullington where he requested to be buried. His inventory only totalled £4 9s. 4d. but included 16 sheep and wool. The rest of his goods were bequeathed to his father, sister and friends.

Asset File: 
christopher_bodycot_wi_hro_1558b-013.pdf
item.dc:creator: JeanM

item.title: Will and Inventory of John Grant/Grauntt 1557
item.description:
Copyright: 
VCH Hampshire

Grant/Grauntt was a wealthy man with 320 sheep, 27 pigs, 26 cattle and five horses listed in his inventory which totalled £115 14s. 6d. He had 32 a. of wheat and considerable grain stored in the barns. He left instructions that his farm should be left to his wife with the guidance of another family member, but if she remarried she was to leave the farm equipment to his grandson.

Asset File: 
john_grant_wi_hro_1557u-119.pdf
item.dc:creator: JeanM
